data.enText: run/drive after
to run, drive, etc. after sb/sth in order to catch them
My dog likes chasing rabbits.

data.chText: 孩子们围着厨房的桌子相互追逐嬉戏。
data.enText: The kids chased each other around the kitchen table.

data.chText: 他追赶那个盗贼却没有抓住他。
data.enText: He chased after the burglar but couldn't catch him.
money/work/success
to try to obtain or achieve sth, for example money, work or success

data.chText: 如今有太多的人在角逐寥寥无几的工作职位。
data.enText: Too many people are chasing too few jobs nowadays.

data.chText: 这支队伍正全力争取获得五场比赛的首场胜利。
data.enText: The team is chasing its first win in five games.
man/woman
to try to persuade sb to have a sexual relationship with you

data.chText: 凯文几个月来一直在追求简。
data.enText: Kevin's been chasing after Jan for months.
Girls are always chasing him.
remind sb
to persuade sb to do sth that they should have done already

data.chText: 我得催他组织安排这次会议。
data.enText: I need to chase him about organizing the meeting.
rush
to rush or hurry somewhere

data.chText: 为了送给莎伦一件礼物，我一上午都在满城奔走寻觅。
data.enText: I've been chasing around town all morning looking for a present for Sharon.
metal
to cut patterns or designs on metal
chased silver
chase your (own) tail
to be very busy but in fact achieve very little
chase sb/sth↔away, off, out, etc.
to force sb/sth to run away
chase sb↔up
to contact sb in order to remind them to do sth that they should have done already

data.chText: 我们得催促所有未付费的成员交费。
data.enText: We need to chase up all members who have not yet paid.
chase sth↔up
chase sth↔down
to find sth that is needed; to deal with sth that has been forgotten

data.chText: 我的工作是催促迟迟不送回来的答复。
data.enText: My job was to chase up late replies.
running/driving after
an act of running or driving after sb/sth in order to catch them

data.chText: 经过短暂追捕，小偷被警察擒获。
data.enText: The thieves were caught by police after a short chase.
a high-speed car chase

data.chText: 我们在狭窄的街道上被他甩掉，不得不放弃对他的追捕。
data.enText: We lost him in the narrow streets and had to give up the chase (= stop chasing him) .
to take up the chase (= start chasing sb)
for success/money/work
a process of trying hard to get sth

data.chText: 有三支队伍参加冠军的角逐。
data.enText: Three teams are involved in the chase for the championship.
in sport
hunting animals as a sport
cut to the chase

data.chText: 不绕圈子直截了当地说；开门见山
data.enText: to stop wasting time and start talking about the most important thing

data.chText: 对啦，咱们开门见山吧。这要多少钱？
data.enText: Right, let's cut to the chase. How much is it going to cost?
give chase
to begin to run after sb/sth in order to catch them
We gave chase along the footpath.

ex.zh: 追求某人/设法获得某物

data.enText: chase your (own) tail
to be very busy but in fact achieve very little
cut to the chase

data.chText: 不绕圈子直截了当地说；开门见山
data.enText: to stop wasting time and start talking about the most important thing

data.chText: 对啦，咱们开门见山吧。这要多少钱？
data.enText: Right, let's cut to the chase. How much is it going to cost?
give chase
to begin to run after sb/sth in order to catch them
We gave chase along the footpath.
chase sb/sth↔away, off, out, etc.
to force sb/sth to run away
chase sb↔up
to contact sb in order to remind them to do sth that they should have done already

data.chText: 我们得催促所有未付费的成员交费。
data.enText: We need to chase up all members who have not yet paid.
chase sth↔up
chase sth↔down
to find sth that is needed; to deal with sth that has been forgotten

data.chText: 我的工作是催促迟迟不送回来的答复。
data.enText: My job was to chase up late replies.

tr: the act of pursuing in an effort to overtake or capture
example: the culprit started to run and the cop took off in pursuit

tr: a rectangular metal frame used in letterpress printing to hold together the pages or columns of composed type that are printed at one time
cut a furrow into a columns
go after with the intent to catch
example: The policeman chased the mugger down the alley

value.def: If you chase someone, or chase after them, you run after them or follow them quickly in order to catch or reach them.

example.ex: She chased the thief for 100 yards...
example.tran: 她追了窃贼100码远。

example.ex: He said nothing to waiting journalists, who chased after him as he left.
example.tran: 他对等候的记者什么也没说就走了，那些记者跟在他后面追。

example.ex: He was reluctant to give up the chase...
example.tran: 他很不情愿放弃追赶。

example.ex: Police said he was arrested without a struggle after a car chase through the streets of Biarritz.
example.tran: 警方说，在比亚里茨的大街小巷经过一阵飞车追逐后，他便乖乖地束手就擒了。

value.def: If you are chasing something you want, such as work or money, you are trying hard to get it.

example.ex: In Wales, 14 people are chasing every job...
example.tran: 在威尔士，每份工作都有14个人在竞争。

example.ex: There are too many schools chasing too few pupils.
example.tran: 太多的学校在争夺太少的生源。

example.ex: ...publishers and booksellers chasing after profits from high-volume sales.
example.tran: 通过薄利多销追求利润的出版社和书商

example.ex: They took an invincible lead in the chase for the championship.
example.tran: 他们在冠军争夺赛中居于不可动摇的领先地位。

value.tran: 争取，追逐，追求(工作或金钱等)

value.def: If someone chases someone that they are attracted to, or chases after them, they try hard to persuade them to have a sexual relationship with them.

example.ex: I'm not very good at flirting or chasing women...
example.tran: 我不太会和女人调情，也不擅长追求女性。

example.ex: 'I was always chasing after unsuitable men,' she says.
example.tran: “我以前老是追错人，”她说。

example.ex: The chase is always much more exciting than the conquest anyway.
example.tran: 不管怎么说，追求的过程总比得手更为刺激。

value.def: If someone chases you from a place, they force you to leave by using threats or violence.

example.ex: Many farmers will then chase you off their land quite aggressively...
example.tran: 许多农民然后就会凶巴巴地把你从他们的土地上撵走。

example.ex: Angry demonstrators chased him away.
example.tran: 愤怒的示威者把他赶跑了。

value.def: If someone cuts to the chase, they start talking about or dealing with what is important, instead of less important things.

example.ex: Hi everyone, we all know why we are here today, so let's cut to the chase.
example.tran: 嗨，各位，大伙儿都知道今天我们为什么在这里，那就直入正题吧。

value.def: To chase someone from a job or a position or from power means to force them to leave it.

example.ex: His single-minded pursuit of European union helped chase Mrs Thatcher from power.
example.tran: 他对欧洲统一的执著追求在一定程度上促成了撒切尔夫人的下台。

value.def: If you chase somewhere, you run or rush there.

example.ex: They chased down the stairs into the narrow, dirty street.
example.tran: 他们冲下楼梯，来到狭窄、肮脏的街上。

example.ex: ...chasing about late at night in search of life's necessities.
example.tran: 深更半夜东奔西跑寻找生活必需品

value.def: The chase is the activity of hunting animals.

example.ex: ...bear robes, mountain lion hides, and other trophies of the chase.
example.tran: 熊皮袍子、美洲狮的皮，以及这次狩猎的其他战利品

value.def: Chase is often used in the name of horse races in which the horses have to jump over obstacles such as fences or bushes.

example.ex: ...the Champion Hunter Chase.
example.tran: 猎人王越野赛马

value.def: If you give chase, you run after someone or follow them quickly in order to catch them.

example.ex: Other officers gave chase but the killers escaped.
example.tran: 其他警官追了上去，可是杀手还是逃了。

value.def: If you talk about the thrill of the chase, you are referring to the excitement that people feel when they are trying hard to get something.

example.ex: People who adore the thrill of the chase know that prizes, like diamonds, are worth striving for.
example.tran: 享受追求过程中的刺激的人们清楚，奖赏和钻石一样，是值得为之一搏的。

trans: 美国大通银行；摩根大通银行；摩根大通；美国摩根大通银行；上的摩根大通
追查清楚；清查；敦促；追着…索要
徒劳的寻找；白费力气的追逐
追到；抓到；（搜寻后）找到，找出
服用鸦片；追龙；吸食海洛因；服用毒品
摩根大通集团；摩根大通；摩根大通银行；摩根大通公司；通公司
追捕，跑步追上；追求（某人）
